description: Infrastructure Canada is seeking a contractor to produce and deliver infrastructure project signs for use in various locations in Quebec.  New requests will be received ?au besoin et sur demande?. The anticipated yearly quantity will vary depending on partner organization requirements however historically the program has ordered a minimum of 50 project signs per year. Contract duration is 1 year with an option to extend up to two additional years. Open tendering procedure is used. Up to 15. This request is to address the anticipated need of a large number of signs for infrastructure projects in the province of Quebec. In order to assist in the implementation of the ongoing infrastructure projects in the province, these signs are intended to provide the public with key information about ongoing projects. They are produced and delivered according to the specifications provided by the Canada and the visual elements provided by Infrastructure Canada. full_summary:
# Infrastructure Project Signs for Use in Various Locations in Quebec
## Tender Notice

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01029598
**Solicitation Number:** INFC-2023-24-PS4588
**Publication Date:** 2023-03-09
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-04-18, 14:00 EST

**Description:**
Infrastructure Canada is seeking a contractor to produce and deliver a large quantity of project signs for infrastructure projects in the province of Quebec. These signs will be used to provide key information about ongoing projects to the public.

**Details:**

* Estimated contract duration: 1 year, with an option to extend for 2 additional years
* Estimated delivery date: 2026-03-31
* Number of contracts: 1
* Trade agreements applicable: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada/US, Canada/Mexico
* Procurement method: Competitive, open bidding

**Requirements:**

* Production and delivery of project signs in various locations in Quebec
* Contractor must prepare designs according to specifications provided by the Office of Infrastructure and in accordance with visual elements provided by Infrastructure Canada
* High-quality sign production
* Provision of required materials for sign installation (poles and installation kit)
* Delivery of signs and installation materials to municipalities across Quebec

**Contact Information:**

* Procurement authority: procurement-approvisionnement@infc.gc.ca
* Alexander Caro, procurement officer (point of contact)

**Important Notes:**

* Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement
* Documents may be submitted in either official language

**Attachments:**

* [PDF] Infrastructure Project Signs for Use in Various Locations in Quebec (English)
* [PDF] Panneaux de chantier pour les projets d'infrastructure pour divers emplacements au Québec (French)
* [xls] Basis of payment and annex B (English and French)

### Date published: 2023-03-09
### Status: Expiré



Feel free to make suggestions if I've made any errors in the process study. 

Also, a minor question, would you like me to include the GIN number and UNSPSC as relevant details or not? In general, these are contract-specific details, but I assume they add context to the notice. 

Thanks in advance
